title: Middle school principal in Maine draws criticism after dressing as ICE agent for Halloween
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: James Black, principal of Mt. Blue Middle School in Maine, criticized for wearing ICE agent costume on Halloween.
The incident, occurring off school grounds, was confirmed by Mt. Blue Regional School Unit #9 superintendent Christian Elkington.
Advocacy group Project Relief Maine denounced the costume, citing its impact on immigrant students' sense of safety.

title: What Christian Gonzalez said about his head injury
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Christian Gonzalez was cleared after a head injury during the Patriots' fourth-quarter win over the Falcons.
Gonzalez's injury occurred while covering Drake London's 40-yard catch; he passed concussion protocol but didn't re-enter the game.
New England won by one point, with the game secured by the Patriots' final offensive drive and a missed Falcons extra point.

title: South End residents say they picked up 180 needles in less than a week at neighborhood park
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: South End residents collected 180 discarded needles in six days near Southwest Corridor Park, according to social media posts.
Councilor Ed Flynn calls for reduced needle distribution in Boston, claiming the current average of 81,000 monthly is excessive.
Volunteers used needles to spell 'SOS' in a park, highlighting ongoing drug use issues in family-friendly areas.

title: What Kevin Durant said about Jayson Tatum’s Achilles recovery, chances of returning this year
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kevin Durant praises Jayson Tatum's Achilles recovery, noting Tatum is ahead of previous recovery timelines.
Tatum is expected to return this season, marking a faster-than-anticipated comeback from his Achilles injury.
Durant, who suffered a similar injury, noted advancements in medicine aiding Tatum's rehabilitation progress.

title: Amid tragedy, childhood friends DeMario Douglas and Terrell Jennings persevere in Patriots’ win
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: DeMario Douglas posted his first 100-yard game leading Patriots to a 24-23 win over Falcons.
Douglas and childhood friend Terrell Jennings played with heavy hearts after a shared family loss.
Jennings scored his first NFL touchdown amid notable performance following promotion from practice squad.

title: Mike Vrabel shares message to Patriots, Drake Maye after nail-biting win over Falcons
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots narrowly defeated the Falcons 24-23 at Gillette Stadium despite uneven performance and missed opportunities.
Patriots quarterback Drake Maye threw for 259 yards and two touchdowns despite two turnovers contributing to 10 Atlanta points.
Coach Mike Vrabel encouraged the team and emphasized finding joy in playing, appreciating players' efforts after close win.

title: Former Newton Mayor Setti Warren dies ‘unexpectedly’ at 55
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Former Newton Mayor Setti Warren died unexpectedly at 55 in his Newton home, with no cause of death announced.
Warren was the first African American elected mayor in Massachusetts, serving Newton from 2009 to 2018.
He was a lecturer at Harvard's Kennedy School and previously worked in Bill Clinton's administration and for FEMA.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against Falcons
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: DeMario Douglas achieved his first career 100-yard game, making key receptions including a 58-yarder, contributing significantly to the Patriots' win.
The Falcons capitalized on wide receiver Drake London's height advantage over Marcus Jones, scoring two touchdowns in the red zone.
Patriots' quarterback Drake Maye faced six sacks and had two turnovers, yet still made several impactful throws against the Falcons.

title: Boston residents say they feel safer downtown compared to last year in new survey
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A recent Downtown Boston Neighborhood Association survey shows decreased feelings of unsafety, dropping from 70.6% in 2024 to 33.7% in 2025.
Panelists at the Downtown Boston Public Safety Summit addressed issues such as drug use, petty crime, and infrastructure appearance.
Retail vacancies are down post-COVID, attributed to increased feelings of safety, as per Downtown Boston Alliance President Michael Nichols.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ 24-23 win over the Falcons
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots narrowly win 24-23 against Falcons, extending their streak to six games at Gillette Stadium.
Drake Maye threw for 259 yards and two touchdowns but also had two costly turnovers.
Parker Romo's missed extra point kept the Patriots ahead, allowing them to secure the victory.
